It's interesting how the 12.9" iPad Pro is seen as the BIG one, in the same way that the 15" MacBook Pro is seen as the BIG one.
In real life, the new 12.9" iPad Pro is: - Same width (greatest dimension) as 12" MacBook - Slightly thinner - About 1.5-2cm longer front to back

I think the 11" iPad Pro will be the right choice for the majority of people. But the new 12.9" is sufficiently smaller than before â€”Â and feels smaller â€” that it's less of a compromise if you have a genuine use case for it.
